SEARCH
Package com.github.blutorange.maven.plugin.closurecompiler.plugin

Class HtmlUpdate

java.lang.Object
com.github.blutorange.maven.plugin.closurecompiler.plugin.HtmlUpdate
public class HtmlUpdate extends Object
Configuration for updating an HTML files with the generated script files. Used by the htmlUpdates option of the minify plugin.
Since:
2.32.0

  • Constructor Details

    • HtmlUpdate

      public HtmlUpdate()

  • Method Details

    • getAttributes

      public List<String> getAttributes()
      A list of attributes to set to the new script path. Defaults to "src" when empty.
      Returns:
      Attributes of the script element to update.

    • getFiles

      public FileSet getFiles()
      File set with the HTML files to update. Relative file paths are evaluated relative to the htmlDir. Both HTML and XHTML files are supported.

      Defaults to **/*.html, i.e. include all HTML files in the htmlDir.

      Returns:
      HTML files to include and exclude.

    • getDir

      public String getDir()
      Base directory relative to which the htmlFiles to process are evaluated. Relative paths are evaluated relative to the htmlDir option of the plugin configuration.

      When not given, defaults to the htmlDir option of the plugin configuration.

      Returns:
      Directory with the HTML files.

    • getSourcePath

      public String getSourcePath()
      When given, the usePhysicalRoot, htmlRoot, htmlScriptRoot options are ignored.

      The path to use as the src attribute for the script file.

      Variables are specified via #{variableName}. To insert a literal #, use ##. The following variables are supported:

      • The variable filename is replaced with the name of the script file.
      • The variable extension is replaced with the extension of the script file (without the period)
      • The variable basename is replaced with the basename (name without the extension) of the script
      • The variable path is replaced with the path of the script file, relative to the htmlScriptRoot

      Precedence: sourcePath has the highest priority. usePhysicalRoot comes next, root and scriptRoot have the lowest priority.

      Returns:
      Pattern for the script source to set on the script element.

    • getRoot

      public String getRoot()
      This option is ignored when sourcePath or usePhysicalRoot is set.

      The root directory of the HTML files. Used to construct a relative path from the HTML file the script file.

      Relative paths are resolved against the htmlRoot option of the plugin configuration. Defaults to the htmlRoot option of the plugin configuration.

      Use a single slash (/) to use the physical path of the HTML file on the file system (works regardless of the OS).

      For example, assume the following configuration:

      • HTML file - /home/user/project/src/main/resources/webapp/public/pages/profile/index.html
      • Script file - /home/user/project/target/generated-resources/frontend/js/public/resources/main/script.min.js
      • HTML root - /home/user/project/src/main/resources/webapp
      • Script root - /home/user/project/target/generated-resources/frontend/js
      Then, the relative path of the HTML file relative to the HTML root is public/pages/profile/index.html and the relative of the JavaScript file is public/resources/main/script.min.js.

      Finally, the script file is relativized against the HTML file; and the final relative path used to update the script tag in the HTML file is ../../resources/main/script.min.js

      Precedence: sourcePath has the highest priority. usePhysicalRoot comes next, root and scriptRoot have the lowest priority.

      Returns:
      Root path of the HTML files.

    • getScriptRoot

      public String getScriptRoot()
      This option is ignored when sourcePath or usePhysicalRoot is set.

      The root directory of the script files. Used to construct a relative path from the HTML file the script file.

      Relative paths are resolved against the htmlScriptRoot option of the plugin configuration. Defaults to the htmlScriptRoot option of the plugin configuration.

      Use a single slash (/) to use the physical path of the HTML file on the file system (works regardless of the OS).

      For example, assume the following configuration:

      • HTML file - /home/user/project/src/main/resources/webapp/public/pages/profile/index.html
      • Script file - /home/user/project/target/generated-resources/frontend/js/public/resources/main/script.min.js
      • HTML root - /home/user/project/src/main/resources/webapp
      • Script root - /home/user/project/target/generated-resources/frontend/js
      Then, the relative path of the HTML file relative to the HTML root is public/pages/profile/index.html and the relative of the JavaScript file is public/resources/main/script.min.js.

      Finally, the script file is relativized against the HTML file; and the final relative path used to update the script tag in the HTML file is ../../resources/main/script.min.js

      Precedence: sourcePath has the highest priority. usePhysicalRoot comes next, root and scriptRoot have the lowest priority.

      Returns:
      Root path of the script files.

    • getScripts

      public String getScripts()
      Specifier for the scripts to update. May be one of the following:
      • id:[ID} - Searches for a script element with the specified ID.
      • css:[selector] - Searches for the script elements via the given CSS selector. Should match the scripts to update. For example, css:.custom will select all script elements with the class custom.
      • xpath:[xpath] - Searches for the script elements via the given XPath selector. Should match the scripts to update. For example, css://script will select all script elements.
      When not given, defaults to the first script element in the document.
      Returns:
      Selector for the script elements to update.

    • getEncoding

      public String getEncoding()
      The encoding (charset) of the HTML files. Defaults to UTF-8.
      Returns:
      The encoding of the HTML file.

    • isUsePhysicalRoot

      public Boolean isUsePhysicalRoot()
      This option is ignored when sourcePath is set.

      When set to true, the root and scriptRoot options are ignored; and the physical location of the HTML and script files on the file system is used to construct the relative path of the script file against the HTML file.

      Precedence: sourcePath has the highest priority. usePhysicalRoot comes next, root and scriptRoot have the lowest priority.

      Returns:
      Whether to use the physical location of the HTML and script file on the file system for constructing relative paths.
